As the pandemic progresses in Europe and still in line with a benign outcome, several SARS-COV-2 related cutaneous features were reported in children with peculiar attention on chilblains.
4 5 This is of particular interest, as we will discuss later, in the context of possible association with vasculitis and considering that chilblains are one of the hallmarks of monogenic lupus and of interferonopathies, which often enters the differential diagnosis with viral infections (eg, Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome).
